Line5.BC41E: I’ve a young man in my care who’s been bitten by a spider. His parents died just last week, bearing similar bites. The venom took them in mere hours... but something slows it in him. He's been clinging on for days.
Line7.BC41E: Symptoms: Fever, cold sweat, wheezing breath. Odd little bumps that sometimes move beneath the skin. Won’t take food or water.
Line9.BC41E: The strangest one of all: other spiders won’t leave the poor lad alone. What draws them to the bite? Please, send help.
